p: Some synonyms include F. eriobotryoides Kunth & C.D. Bouché, F. afeelii Kunth and C.D.Bouché, F.dawei Hutch, F. murrayana Miq., F. monbuttuensis Warb., F. dawei Hutch, or Galoglychia saussureana Gasp. It is a large, mostly epiphytic, hemi-epiphytic, or terrestrial tree [ 27, 28]. The base of the trunk consists of a mass of fused aerial roots. It produces large amounts of white latex. The slash typically discolours, but the latex does not [ 28]. It is a widely distributed tree in West Africa and the eastern and western margins of the Congo Basin [ 29]. In Uganda, it mainly occurs in the northern, western, and south-central parts [ 28]. F. saussureana prefers riverine, groundwater, and lowland forest areas [ 27]. The local name in Luganda language is as follows: muwo [ 14, 21].
